Class BaseSTBMachine

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api.BaseSTBItem
      • me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api.BaseSTBBlock
        • me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api.BaseSTBMachine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<BaseSTBItem>, Chargeable, ChargeableBlock, InventoryGUIListener, STBInventoryHolder, STBFreezable, InventoryHolder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractProcessingMachine, BasicSolarCell, BatteryBox

    public abstract class BaseSTBMachine
extends BaseSTBBlock
implements ChargeableBlock, STBInventoryHolder

      • hasShapedRecipes

        public boolean hasShapedRecipes()
        Check whether this machine requires shaped recipes. By default, machines use shapeless recipes (of possibly only one item), but this can be overridden by machines if shaped recipes will be used.
        Returns:
        true if shaped recipes will be used; false otherwise

      • addCustomRecipes

        public void addCustomRecipes(CustomRecipeManager crm)
        Add any custom recipes for this machine. By default this method does nothing; override if necessary to add any custom recipes.
        Parameters:
        crm - the recipe manager object

      • isJammed

        public final boolean isJammed()
        Check if the machine is jammed; if it has work to do, but no space in its output slot(s).
        Returns:
        true if the machine is jammed

      • getRedstoneBehaviourSlot

        public int getRedstoneBehaviourSlot()
        Get the inventory slot where a redstone behaviour gadget will be displayed. The default is slot 8; right-hand edge of the top row.
        Returns:
        an inventory slot number, or -1 for no gadget

      • getAccessControlSlot

        public int getAccessControlSlot()
        Get the inventory slot where an access control gadget will be displayed. The default is slot 17; right-hand edge of the second row.
        Returns:
        an inventory slot number, or -1 for no gadget

      • getChargeMeterSlot

        public int getChargeMeterSlot()
        Get the inventory slot where an charge meter gadget will be displayed. The default is slot 26; right-hand edge of the third row.
        Specified by:
        getChargeMeterSlot in interface ChargeableBlock
        Returns:
        an inventory slot number, or -1 for no gadget

      • getEnergyCellSlot

        public int getEnergyCellSlot()
        Get the inventory slot for an energy cell slot, where an energy cell can be inserted. The default is -1; no energy cell slot.
        Returns:
        an inventory slot number, or -1 for no energy cell

      • getChargeDirectionSlot

        public int getChargeDirectionSlot()
        Get the inventory slot for an charge direction slot; where the energy flow between machine and energy cell can be changed. The default is -1; no gadget. If a gadget is added, it is recommended to place it adjacent to the energy cell slot defined with getEnergyCellSlot()
        Returns:
        an inventory slot number, or -1 for no energy cell

      • getInventoryGUISize

        public int getInventoryGUISize()
        Get the size for this machine's GUI, in slots. The size must be a multiple of 9. The default size is 54 slots (6 rows).
        Returns:
        the number of inventory slots in this machine's GUI

      • onInteractBlock

        public void onInteractBlock(PlayerInteractEvent event)
        Description copied from class: BaseSTBBlock
        Called when an STB block is interacted with by a player. The default behaviour allows for the block to be labelled by left-clicking it with a sign in hand. If you override this method and want to keep this behaviour, be sure to call super.onInteractBlock().
        Overrides:
        onInteractBlock in class BaseSTBBlock
        Parameters:
        event - the interaction event

        Overrides:

        Parameters:

      • acceptsItemType

        public boolean acceptsItemType(ItemStack item)
        Check if the given item would be accepted as input to this machine. By default, every item type is accepted, but this can be overridden in subclasses.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to check
        Returns:
        true if the item is accepted, false otherwise

        Returns:

      • isUpgradeSlot

        public boolean isUpgradeSlot(int slot)
        Check if the given slot can be used to install upgrades, i.e. STB items which subclass MachineUpgrade
        Parameters:
        slot - the slot to check
        Returns:
        true if this is an upgrade slot, false otherwise

      • insertItems

        public int insertItems(ItemStack toInsert,
              BlockFace side,
              boolean sorting,
              UUID uuid)
        Description copied from interface: STBInventoryHolder
        Attempt to actually insert an item into the block on the given side.

        If a non-null uuid is provided, an access rights check should be made.

        Specified by:
        insertItems in interface STBInventoryHolder
        Parameters:
        toInsert - the item stack to insert (an attempt will be made to insert all items)
        side - the side to insert into; BlockFace.SELF may be used if insertion is manual
        sorting - if true, only insert if inventory is empty or already contains the item
        uuid - ID of the player who is doing the extracting (may be null)
        Returns:
        the number of items actually inserted

      • extractItems

        public ItemStack extractItems(BlockFace face,
                     ItemStack receiver,
                     int amount,
                     UUID uuid)
        Description copied from interface: STBInventoryHolder
        Attempt to extract items from the block on the given side. The size of the returned item stack could be smaller than the requested amount.

        If a receiver is specified, items will be only be extracted if they will stack with the receiver, and only up to the receiver's natural maximum stack size.

        If a non-null uuid is provided, an access rights check should be made.

        Specified by:
        extractItems in interface STBInventoryHolder
        Parameters:
        face - the side to extract from; BlockFace.SELF may be used if extraction is manual
        receiver - buffer to receive the items (may be null)
        amount - the number of items to request
        uuid - ID of the player who is doing the extracting (may be null)
        Returns:
        the item stack extracted, or null if no item was extracted

      • showOutputItems

        public Inventory showOutputItems(UUID uuid)
        Description copied from interface: STBInventoryHolder
        Get a view of the items which can be extracted from this inventory holder. Note that the returned inventory is a copied view, and modifying it will not change the inventory holder's actual contents (but see STBInventoryHolder.updateOutputItems(UUID, org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory))

        If the player does not have access to this holder, or the holder provides no output slots, then this method will return null.

        Specified by:
        showOutputItems in interface STBInventoryHolder
        Parameters:
        uuid - UUID of the player trying to get the view
        Returns:
        an inventory containing a copy of the items which can be extracted, may be null

      • updateOutputItems

        public void updateOutputItems(UUID uuid,
                     Inventory inventory)
        Description copied from interface: STBInventoryHolder
        Update (overwrite) the STB output inventory slots with the contents of the supplied inventory.

        If the player does not have access to this holder, or the holder provides no output slots, then this method is a no-op.

        Specified by:
        updateOutputItems in interface STBInventoryHolder
        Parameters:
        uuid - UUID of the player trying to update the inventory
        inventory - the source inventory to update items from

      • onSlotClick

        public boolean onSlotClick(HumanEntity player,
                  int slot,
                  ClickType click,
                  ItemStack inSlot,
                  ItemStack onCursor)
        Description copied from interface: InventoryGUIListener
        Called when a slot in an inventory GUI is clicked by a player.
        Specified by:
        onSlotClick in interface InventoryGUIListener
        Overrides:
        onSlotClick in class BaseSTBItem
        Parameters:
        player - the player who clicked
        slot - the raw inventory slot which was clicked
        click - the click type
        inSlot - the item currently in the clicked slot
        onCursor - the item on the player's cursor
        Returns:
        true if the click should go ahead, false if it should be cancelled

      • onShiftClickInsert

        public int onShiftClickInsert(HumanEntity player,
                     int slot,
                     ItemStack toInsert)
        Description copied from interface: InventoryGUIListener
        Called when an attempt is made to shift-click an item into an inventory GUI. The implementor is responsible for actually putting items into the appropriate slot(s) of the inventory GUI, but the stack being clicked will be automatically adjusted, based on this method's return value.
        Specified by:
        onShiftClickInsert in interface InventoryGUIListener
        Overrides:
        onShiftClickInsert in class BaseSTBItem
        Parameters:
        player - the player who clicked
        slot - the slot that was shift-clicked
        toInsert - the item stack to be inserted
        Returns:
        the number of items from the stack that were actually inserted

      • onShiftClickExtract

        public boolean onShiftClickExtract(HumanEntity player,
                          int slot,
                          ItemStack toExtract)
        Description copied from interface: InventoryGUIListener
        Called when an attempt is made to shift-click an item out of an inventory GUI.
        Specified by:
        onShiftClickExtract in interface InventoryGUIListener
        Overrides:
        onShiftClickExtract in class BaseSTBItem
        Parameters:
        player - the player who clicked
        slot - the slot in the inventory GUI that was shift-clicked
        toExtract - the number of items being extracted
        Returns:

      • installEnergyCell

        public void installEnergyCell(EnergyCell cell)

      • getTickRate

        public int getTickRate()
        Description copied from class: BaseSTBBlock
        Defines the rate at which the block ticks. BaseSTBBlock.onServerTick() will be called this frequently. Override this method to have the block tick less frequently. The default rate of 0 means that the block will not tick at all.
        Overrides:
        getTickRate in class BaseSTBBlock

      • onServerTick

        public void onServerTick()
        Description copied from class: BaseSTBBlock
        Called every tick for each STB block that is placed in the world, for any STB block where BaseSTBBlock.getTickRate() returns a non-zero value. Override this method to define any periodic behaviour of the block.
        Overrides:
        onServerTick in class BaseSTBBlock

        public EnergyNet[] getAttachedEnergyNets()
        Description copied from interface: ChargeableBlock

        Specified by:
